description.plain:
Mother Mother is a five-piece Canadian indie rock band originally from Quadra Island, now based in Vancouver, British Columbia. Mother Mother consists of Ryan Guldemond on guitar and vocals, Molly Guldemond on vocals and keyboard, Jasmin Parkin on keyboard and vocals, Ali Siadat on drums, and Mike Young on bass (as longtime bassist Jeremy Page left the group in 2016).

In 2005, they independently released their self-titled debut album under the band name Mother. They later changed their name to Mother Mother, and re-released the album on Last Gang Records in 2007. Retitled Touch Up, the reissue also featured several new songs.

They would go on to release O My Heart in 2008, Eureka in 2011, The Sticks in 2012, Very Good Bad Thing in 2014, No Culture in 2017, and Dance And Cry in 2018. In 2020, they found new attention among TikTok users, especially straight to their first two albums. They are currently working on their eighth LP, and two singles have been released for it, I Got Love and Stay Behind, both on March 5, 2021.

body.plain:
Mother Mother is a five-piece Canadian indie rock band originally from Quadra Island, now based in Vancouver, British Columbia. Mother Mother consists of Ryan Guldemond on guitar and vocals, Molly Guldemond on vocals and keyboard, Jasmin Parkin on keyboard and vocals, Ali Siadat on drums, and Mike Young on bass (as longtime bassist Jeremy Page left the group in 2016).

In 2005, they independently released their self-titled debut album under the band name Mother. They later changed their name to Mother Mother, and re-released the album on Last Gang Records in 2007. Retitled Touch Up, the reissue also featured several new songs.

They would go on to release O My Heart in 2008, Eureka in 2011, The Sticks in 2012, Very Good Bad Thing in 2014, No Culture in 2017, and Dance And Cry in 2018. In 2020, they found new attention among TikTok users, especially straight to their first two albums. They are currently working on their eighth LP, and two singles have been released for it, I Got Love and Stay Behind, both on March 5, 2021.

songs.title: Verbatim

description.plain: Who cares if you act feminine or masculine or anything else? We’re all gonna die anyways.

songs.embed_content: Read “Verbatim” by Mother Mother on Genius

songs.title: Hayloft

description.plain:
“Hayloft” is the eighth track on Mother Mother’s 2008 album O My Heart.

The track’s lyrics describe two “young lovers” caught having sex in the hayloft of a barn, and the ensuing rage of the father, who has brought his gun to investigate and intends to shoot his child’s lover, seemingly not because of the trespassing, but instead the fact that they’re having sex.

A hayloft is defined as “a loft over a stable or barn used for storing hay or straw.”

songs.embed_content: Read “Hayloft” by Mother Mother on Genius

A hayloft is defined as “a loft over a stable or barn used for storing hay or straw.”

songs.title: Oh Ana

description.plain:
This song has been “confirmed” to have no meaning, as it was apparently just a bunch of random lyrics put together* . Though many have their own interpretations of song, a notable example is the theory that it’s about anorexia.

*- I am unable to find a source for this, but there has been no confirmation that the song is about anorexia either, I will update with a source if one is found.

songs.embed_content: Read “Oh Ana” by Mother Mother on Genius
